message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM 

This paper deals with secure communication in wireless environments, which is a topic that falls under several arXiv CS sub-categories. The most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory), as the paper focuses on achieving information-theoretic secrecy. The next likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), as the paper presents a method to exploit vulnerabilities of the eavesdropper's receiver to obtain everlasting secrecy. The third likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), as the paper deals with secure communication over a wiretap channel in a wireless environment. The fourth likely category is cs.SY (Systems and Control), as the paper presents a method to add random jamming signals to the transmitted signal to achieve secrecy. The fifth likely category is cs.MM (Multimedia), as the paper considers a wideband system where frequency hopping is used in addition to jamming to achieve security.
